authors.name: Paul  Robson
authors.affiliation: The Jackson Laboratory for Genomic Medicine

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d2avn","text":"The purpose of this protocol is to produce single nuclei from frozen human tissues for downstream assaying with the  10x Genomics Multiome assay.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mo2o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"51tr7","text":"This protocol has been demonstrated using Human placenta tissue as well as human Glioblastoma.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"34d9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5da5u","text":"This protocol is modified from Sigma Aldrich Nuclei Isolation Kit: EZ Prep protocol and 10x Chromium Demonstrated protocol for Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression Sequencing (CG000365).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bl0dv","text":"Assess nuclear membrane integrity (refer to 10x Genomics CG000365), using Brightfield or Trypan blue","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ehdv","text":"Assess for debris, if large amount of debris present, filter with smaller pore size to decrease debris. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c0q9c","text":"Use either Trypan blue and Countess (for clean average size nuclei preps) or AO/PI and Nexcellom K2 counter (if nuclei prep has debris)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4r373","text":"If RNA content is of concern Imaging nuclei can be done with fluorescence, and Syto RNA stain","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ffq7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b4hnr","text":"Slightly thaw sample out on ice and place onto pre chilled Petri dish on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ftho","text":"Cut tissue into small pieces and add to a microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vboe","text":"In micro centrifuge tube containing the tissue add   of lysis buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"cu80j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"22EDA8D0A4B111EC86050B5523416738","id":"89939","label":"lysis buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tjsn","text":"Using a plastic pestle to grind tissue by pushing pestle down and twisting to break up the tissue. {"blocks":[{"key":"aepc9","text":"Remove supernatant and resuspend pellet using wide bore tips in  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5a9l5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"5FDC1BF0A4B111EC86050B5523416738","id":"89941","label":"lysis buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38ori","text":"Load for transposition and continue with the 10x multiome protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
